definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: She is a cultured and bright girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個溫文爾雅，聰明伶俐的女孩。

sentences.english: It is easy to teach smart students.
sentences.chinese: 教聰明伶俐的學生很輕鬆。

sentences.english: You being so clever and all.
sentences.chinese: 你一向都這麼聰明伶俐。

sentences.english: I recognize that he is cleverer than I am.
sentences.chinese: 他的聰明伶俐超過我所料想的。

sentences.english: Most people think I'm really cute.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人認爲我聰明伶俐。

sentences.english: We treasure the healthy growth of Zai Zai, bright, lively and lovely.
sentences.chinese: 我們的寶貝仔仔健康成長，聰明伶俐，活潑可愛。

sentences.english: Mary never tires of talking about her clever son.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗談起她聰明伶俐的兒子從不感到厭倦。
這個女孩看起來聰明伶俐。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Whippets , These are cute little whippet puppies.
sentences.chinese: 這些是聰明伶俐小小靈狗幼仔。

definition: pampered son of a wealthy family
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
